str: The buttons located under the Chat Window on the left side of the screen have the following functions:
SEND displays your message to everyone in your chat Channel
WHISPER sends your message only to the character that you have selected. This button is activated as soon as you start typing in the Text Box and have another character selected.

SQUELCH filters out incoming messages from the character that you have selected. Characters that you have squelched are marked with a red X graphic. This button is activated as soon as you select another character.
UNSQUELCH allows you to again receive incoming messages from a character that has been squelched.
EMOTE lets you perform an action that the whole room can <see> as represented through text.
dgrey;Gray Textgold; indicates when someone Joins or Leaves the chat Channel.
an;Gold Textgold; indicates the name of the player speaking.
grey;White Textgold; indicates what you or others have said out loud to the entire chat Channel.
green;Green Textgold; indicates what you have <whispered> to a specific person
lue;Blue Textgold; represents actions that have been taken by people in the chat Channel or special messages sent directly from battle.net.
ed;Red Textgold; represents error messages sent directly from battle.net.
This window on the right side of the screen is used to display and enter both game and profile information. Unlike the Chat Window
Lets you form a new game for other players to join. There are several choices listed below that you need to make when creating a new game
Game Name is how you want your game to be displayed in the Join Game screen. It can be cryptic or descriptive
Password gives you the option to make your game Private. Other players who wish to join your game will need to know the password you have selected.
Game Description lets you say something about the game you are forming. This is a good way to advertise for the kind of player or character you want to join your game.
Maximum Number of Players sets a limit as to how many characters can be in your game at any one time. The default setting is 4. You can change the number of players

Character Difference sets a range above and below the level of your character that other characters joining your game must fall into. The default setting is set at 4 to determine who can join your game.
Lets you enter an existing game. Games that are listed in this screen are considered Public and can be can be joined any time they have space for a player within them.
Selecting a game from this list will display information on the game
Lets you join an existing chat Channel or gives you the opportunity to create a Channel of your own. To enter an established Public Channel
If you wish to start your own Channel
Allows you to view your character's ranking in the Diablo II Ladders for your Realm.
The STANDARD LADDER displays the top characters
The HARDCORE LADDER displays the top Hardcore characters

You can access any of these advanced features by entering the following commands in the Text Box where you normally type messages:
Sends a private message to another user on battle.net
Allows you to perform an action in the chat room.
Allows you to ignore messages from the indicated user.
Allows you to again receive messages from this user.
Lets other people who send you messages know that you are away from your keyboard and cannot respond. You may provide a reason for your absence
Lets other people who send you messages know that you do not wish to be disturbed. You may provide a reason for your absence
Takes you to the battle.net Channel of your choice. If you wanted to enter the technical support Channel
Provides you with a list of the battle.net account names of the players that are currently in the requested battle.net Channel.
Bans an account from entering a private Channel and can only be issued by the Channel operator. Use /unban <accountname> to allow accounts banned from a private Channel back into that Channel.
Designates the player of your choice to become the next Channel operator
Kicks an account from a private Channel and can only be issued by the Channel operator. The kicked player
Causes a Channel operator to rejoin the Channel
Searches for another player in all battle.net Public Chat channels and all Blizzard games
Provides you with your current account number and location on battle.net.
Toggles battle.net Join/Leave notifications in the Chat Channel.
Accesses the general battle.net help text.
Provides you with the current battle.net time and your current Local time.
Provides you with the Ladder statistics for other Blizzard games supported over battle.net. The program ID for each game is as follows; StarCraft < STAR>
Right-clicking on your own character allows you to edit your own profile.
Using the 'Tab' key in the battle.net chat room cycles through the last 10 commands you have issued.

I shall purge this land of the shadow.
I sense death within this place.
I sense great sorrow and misery.
This holy place has been desecrated!
There is dark magic at work here.
The Monastery reeks with evil and corruption.
Even the Light cannot pierce this gloom.
This place has the stench of demons about it.
This tower shall be cleansed of evil.
What nightmarish tortures took place here?
No one should ever be caged.
This is no place for a warrior to die.
So cold and damp under the earth.
This place chills me to the bone.
I sense a demonic presence here.
Perhaps now the Sisters will trust me.
The Rogues are safe for the moment.
This cave has been purged of evil.
Is that enough to earn the Rogues' trust?
This tree is one of a kind.
This ancient tree has an aura of magic about it.
This tree shines with inner spirits.
These stones serve some magical purpose...
Maybe Akara could dispel the mystery of these stones.
I sense many spirits around the stones.
It's as if a great war were fought here.
The land here is dead and lifeless.
What a tragic end to Tristram!
Tristram was no match for Diablo's fury.
All that's left of proud Tristram are ghosts and ashes.
The Sisters will be glad to have this back!
I should take this to Charsi.
This will help the Sisters turn the tide against evil.
I hope the Sisters appreciate this thing...
The Tower's trove... for the taking!
I've earned the right to this abandoned trove.
I hope to find other such treasures!
Treasure hunting... bah... Treasure finding... yes.
This Maiden shall inflict no more anguish.
Back to the hell that spawned you
Ugh... The tell-tale stench of a carnivore's lair.
The foul stench of evil assails me.
I sense a powerful undead being within this place.
I've just about had my fill of the walking dead.
I pray that Atma will rest easy now.
What a waste of undead flesh.
Great. An eclipse. This just keeps getting better and better.
What is wrong with the sun?
What Evil taints the light of the sun?
Only powerful magic can conjure an eclipse.
Only the darkest magics can turn the sun black.
I hope I know what I'm doing!
The sun has never shone here!
Light guide my way in this accursed place.
I sense strong magic within this place.
This place is as dark as a tomb.
It is good to know that the sun shines once again.
The Light can never be extinguished by evil.
Who would have thought that such primitive beings could cause so much trouble!
What a pity. I was beginning to enjoy the darkness.
Am I the first to find this Arcane fortress?
One could get lost in here.
This surely is the product of a twisted mind!
This place actually... distorts reality. Fascinating.
This is fantastic! I wish I had time to study this bizarre dimension.
Surely the evil here has driven you mad.
This bumbling fool cannot be the mighty Horazon!
I hate staining my hands with the blood of foul sorcerers.
That couldn't have been Horazon. Poor wretch.
He was not Horazon. He was a deluded fool who got too close to true power!
This has got to be the right place.
This tomb is very ornate. This must be Tal Rasha's resting place.
Is this the tomb I seek?
This tomb has Horadric markings. I wonder if this is Tal Rasha's tomb?
This could be Tal Rasha's tomb. However
Should I enter...?  Diablo and Baal may have laid a trap...
Such a cold breeze... Tal Rasha must be kept here.
This must be the true Tomb of Tal Rasha!
I sense an incredible aura about this tomb. The Horadrim hid something powerful inside.
This is not good. Will this madness ever end?
I have failed. Diablo has freed his accursed brother. The world remains at their mercy.
I shall honor Tal Rasha's sacrifice by destroying all the Prime Evils.
Diablo and Baal have escaped me!  Next time... vengeance!
I came too late. Now... Destruction is let loose upon the world once more.
I hope the secrets within this book can help us.
I hope this book is worth all the trouble.
The Black Book... It's heresy to the Zakarum High Council.
This tome has the weight of knowledge about it.
This ancient book radiates arcane power!
All this trouble over a tattered book.
May this book lift the shadow from Kurast.
May the Black Book deliver us from evil!
May the Black Book bring a black day to hell!
Once the book has served its purpose
Cough... The stench down here is choking!
The smell of death... or worse... surrounds me.
It smells worse than rotting reagents down here.
It's been years since I waded through sewers for fun.
I hope this does something good...
This will drain out some of the filth.
This appears to control the ancient valves.
This looks like what I've been searching for.
Good. Now I can get out of here and get some fresh air!
This trove will help lift the curse from Kurast!
I hope these items can aid me against the demons.
Great. More junk. Just what I'd expect to find in a sewer...
This dagger will separate the faithful from the fallen.
This holy blade does not belong in the hands of the Zakarum.
This blade shall pierce the heart of evil!
I must take this to Ormus.
This is a powerful weapon. Perhaps Ormus can tell me more about it.
What would this bring from the right buyer?
Perhaps I could trade this for something more valuable?
I don't sense any magic about this item. Very strange.
A worthless statue. Perhaps I can trade this for something better.
Such a dark temple for a Religion of Light...
The spirits of nature have fled this dreaded place.
This corrupted temple was once the shining heart of my religion...
I sense tremendous evil within this place.
The dark powers here will no longer poison the land.
The Temple shall shine anew with the Light.
The Temple's dark power is broken.
This must be where Mephisto is.
The final resting place of Hatred itself.
This must be where the Horadrim imprisoned Mephisto.
Success... But still there's something not right.
Maybe now the world will have peace.
The Lord of Hatred shall darken the world no longer.
Mephisto shall no longer darken our souls with hatred.
Wait... Don't I get three wishes?
How can one who was once so holy fall so far from righteousness?
He was corrupted to the core. I pity him.
Bah! Izual was weak. He squandered his infernal power.
